sentences.en: Crook liked her well enough, but remained indifferent to her feminine charms.
sentences.cn: 克鲁格还比较喜欢她，只是对她的女性魅力却始终无动于衷。
他是个手艺平平的厨师.

sentences.en: He was coldly indifferent to other people.
He was mute, distant, and indifferent.
sentences.cn: 他一句话也不说，显得疏远而冷漠。

sentences.en: His manner was cold and indifferent.
sentences.cn: 他的态度既冷淡又无动于衷.

sentences.en: In her indifferent wandering she turned into Jackson Street.
sentences.cn: 在心不在焉的闲荡中,她转上了杰克生大街.

sentences.en: Indifferent himself to danger , he wept over the sorrows of others.
sentences.cn: 他不顾自身的安危, 抚平他人的创伤.

sentences.en: Much of the food we eat is of very poor or indifferent quality.
sentences.cn: 我们吃的许多食物质量要么很差，要么很一般。

sentences.en: Of all the lazy, indifferent, unbusinesslike attitudes to have!
sentences.cn: 这是多么懒惰、冷漠、不敬业的态度！

sentences.en: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.cn: 人们对别人的痛苦已经变得无动于衷。

sentences.en: She had starred in several very indifferent movies.
sentences.cn: 她主演过几部表现非常一般的电影。

sentences.en: She saw the servant working at dinner with an indifferent eye.
sentences.cn: 她的脑海里则闪现着剧中的一场场戏.

sentences.en: The physical world was and still is indifferent to the mathematicians'classification.
sentences.cn: 物理界过去和现在都是从不关心数学家们的分类的.

sentences.en: The steel workers were relatively indifferent to the issue of nationalization.
sentences.cn: 相对而言，钢铁工人对国有化的议题并不太关心。

words.tran_cn: 冷淡地；漠不关心地；平庸地；相当差地
漠不关心；冷淡；不重视；中立

trans.tran_en: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it
